segments.content: Screenplay by
Graham Yost
Falls from low grey clouds. Down below we see...

Muddy, slow and powerful, overflowing its banks. In the near 

               distance is...

Filled to the maximum, water thundering out of two open gates. 

               We close in on...

There's a Dam Control Office in the middle of the dam. We 

               MOVE OFF the reservoir and head out over...

We see "NO FEAR" spelled out in stones on one man's roof. We 

               go down and into...

Storefronts are sandbagged and closed. A sign on one store 

               reads: GONE FISHING. A sign on another: HEY LOOTER. NOTHING 

               OF VALUE HERE. TRY NEXT DOOR. And on the next store: HE'S

Beautiful, old, ringed with a five-foot-high wall of sandbags. 

               The floodwater is up to the first level of sandbags.

Loaded down, are heading out of town on streets covered in 

               the first water of the flood.

On an island in the middle of the street. It's Civil War-

               era, of a general on a horse, sword held high. The floodwater 

               is over the curb, lapping at the base of statue's pedestal. 

               Near the statue stands...

50s, with soft edges and friendly eyes. He's talking into 

               his radio mike.
EXT. RESERVOIR DAM HANK, the dam control officer, is on the radio with the Sheriff.

character.name: So, are we all going to die?

dialogue.text: EXT. RESERVOIR DAM HANK, the dam control officer, is on the radio with the Sheriff.

segments.content: Not right now. But I'm gonna have to
let out a little more.

WAYNE and PHIL, two deputies, 30s, are near the Sheriff, 

               shoring up a sandbag wall that has partially collapsed.
I think my best was when I turned
twelve. My Dad set up a treasure
hunt. It was really cool.
(off Wayne's disdainful
look)
Wayne shrugs a "whatever" and pulls a sandbag up out of the water. There's unpleasant-looking muck all over his arms. He drops the sandbag back into the water and shakes off the crud with disgust.

dialogue.text: Wayne shrugs a "whatever" and pulls a sandbag up out of the water. There's unpleasant-looking muck all over his arms. He drops the sandbag back into the water and shakes off the crud with disgust.

segments.content: This blows.
My most awful birthday was sweet
sixteen. I had mono. How about you?
What was your worst?
You kidding? You think I could've
possibly had a birthday worse than
this? What kind of loser do you think
I am?
The Sheriff walks over.

dialogue.text: The Sheriff walks over.

segments.content: Hank says he's gonna open another
gate. We're gonna get another rise.
They turn at the sound of honking. The MAYOR drives up.
Gentlemen. Hey -- happy birthday,
Wayne nods. Phil stiffens. They do not like this guy.

dialogue.text: Wayne nods. Phil stiffens. They do not like this guy.

segments.content: (to the Sheriff)
Mike, I gotta say, what you're
doing... I don't know if I'd be here,
considering.
(good-natured)
Well, you would be if you wanted to
get the last couple of paychecks
some bastard owed you.
(grins, then:)
I just want you to know I think the
people 'round here made a big mistake.
Phil grumbles to himself.
"The people"? You're the one who
screwed him.
Sorry, Phil?
(blushes)
I, uh --
(to Mayor, saving
Phil)
You know, Bob, as much as I'd love
to stand here all day talking about
how great I am, if you don't get
moving I'm gonna have to haul your
sorry ass off to jail.
(laughs)
Okay, okay, I'm going. Keep up the
good work, boys. It's appreciated.
The Mayor rolls up his window and heads off.
Whaddya say we go torch the fucker's
house and blame it on looters. Or
how about we put a dead cow in his
living room. He comes back after
it's been in the water a couple of
days. Hello!
(shakes head)
You wanna know how to get the best
revenge on the Mayor and his boys?
You do exactly what we're doing. You
protect the town. You protect it
better than they would. Better than
they ever could.
(thinks, shrugs)
I think the dead cow's better.
(ignores Wayne)
Any looter that comes in here is in
for a big surprise, cause as long as
I'm still wearing this pointy thing...
(indicates badge)
...nobody's taking anything from
this town.

Nervous assistant bank manager WELLMAN is hurriedly tossing 

               stacks of money into two canvas bags.
Washes up on Wellman.
Do you think you could go a little
faster, pal?
SECOND SHADOW COMES UP

character.name: I -- I'm going as fast as I can.

dialogue.text: SECOND SHADOW COMES UP

segments.content: Wellman is about to speak, then sees something, gulps. A SHOTGUN Is held by one of the men, pointed at the floor. WELLMAN Sweeps the money off the shelves and into the bags.

dialogue.text: Wellman is about to speak, then sees something, gulps. A SHOTGUN Is held by one of the men, pointed at the floor. WELLMAN Sweeps the money off the shelves and into the bags.

segments.content: That it?

THE TWO MEN Ignore Wellman, grab the canvas bags and stride off. EXT. BANK - DAY CLOSE ON the lower half of the front doors as they fly open. Out come TWO MEN in long dark raincoats. WELLMAN Runs up, stopping in the open door.

character.name: Yes. We don't keep any of our --

dialogue.text: THE TWO MEN Ignore Wellman, grab the canvas bags and stride off. EXT. BANK - DAY CLOSE ON the lower half of the front doors as they fly open. Out come TWO MEN in long dark raincoats. WELLMAN Runs up, stopping in the open door.

segments.content: VERY CLOSE ON THE TWO MEN As they slowly turn to face Wellman. We just see their faces, shielded from the rain by hat brims. Meet... TOM AND CHARLIE Tom, 30, handsome, with an easy smile. Charlie, 50, with a tough, red face.

dialogue.text: VERY CLOSE ON THE TWO MEN As they slowly turn to face Wellman. We just see their faces, shielded from the rain by hat brims. Meet... TOM AND CHARLIE Tom, 30, handsome, with an easy smile. Charlie, 50, with a tough, red face.

segments.content: WELLMAN Looks nervous for a second, then holds up a clipboard.

dialogue.text: WELLMAN Looks nervous for a second, then holds up a clipboard.

segments.content: TOM AND CHARLIE We see, for the first time, by their hats and uniforms, that they are armored car drivers. There's an armored car parked at the curb, on the other side of a low wall of sandbags. Charlie sighs, goes back to Wellman and perfunctorily signs the form. Then he and Tom go to the sandbag wall. Tom holds both bags in one hand and the shotgun in the other. Charlie doesn't want to get wet. He steps from the sandbag wall onto the rear bumper of the truck, then keys open the doors.

dialogue.text: TOM AND CHARLIE We see, for the first time, by their hats and uniforms, that they are armored car drivers. There's an armored car parked at the curb, on the other side of a low wall of sandbags. Charlie sighs, goes back to Wellman and perfunctorily signs the form. Then he and Tom go to the sandbag wall. Tom holds both bags in one hand and the shotgun in the other. Charlie doesn't want to get wet. He steps from the sandbag wall onto the rear bumper of the truck, then keys open the doors.

segments.content: Charlie reaches out for the money bags. Tom jumps off the sandbag wall and lands in the water, splashing Charlie.

dialogue.text: Charlie reaches out for the money bags. Tom jumps off the sandbag wall and lands in the water, splashing Charlie.

segments.content: For Christsakes!
It's a flood, Charlie. You're gonna
get wet.
Charlie takes the bags, tosses them in then shuts the back.
He moves toward the front, still trying to keep out of the
water. Tom splashes him some more.
Hey! Do you know what kind of crap
is in that water?
(of course he knows)

Tom kicks some more water at Charlie. Charlie gives Tom a withering look and climbs in the truck. INT. ARMORED TRUCK Charlie gets into the driver's seat; Tom climbs into the shotgun seat. They shut and bolt the doors. Charlie gets on the radio.

dialogue.text: Tom kicks some more water at Charlie. Charlie gives Tom a withering look and climbs in the truck. INT. ARMORED TRUCK Charlie gets into the driver's seat; Tom climbs into the shotgun seat. They shut and bolt the doors. Charlie gets on the radio.

segments.content: Dispatch, this is 31.
Go ahead, 31.
We're leaving Huntingburg. We'll be
back in an hour.
Ten-four. Get out of there.
Charlie hangs up the radio. He starts writing on a clipboard. Silence for a few moments, and then Charlie notices Tom staring at him.

dialogue.text: Charlie hangs up the radio. He starts writing on a clipboard. Silence for a few moments, and then Charlie notices Tom staring at him.

segments.content: What?
Your ear.
What about my ear?
You've got a major hair growth going
on.
Shut up.
I'm serious. You're gonna need
somebody to go in there with a weed
whacker.
Charlie grabs a donut bag off the seat and tosses it to Tom.
Here.
You're offering me one of your donuts?
I don't know what to say. I'm getting
all misty.
If it'll shut your mouth you can
have the whole bag.
Charlie starts the truck. Tom thinks about it, then tosses
the bag back.
Nah. I start eating donuts and I'll
never get out of this truck.
(disgusted)
I love how you think you're better
than this.
Don't get me wrong, Charlie. There's
a lot to like about this job -- and
I don't just mean the dashing
polyester ensemble and the solid
three-figure income.
(angry)
You ungrateful shit! I don't believe
you!
(surprised)
Charlie, relax! I was kidding!
You don't wanna do this? Fine. Go
back to selling hot construction
machinery. That's a helluva career.
Charlie slams the clipboard down on the seat.

dialogue.text: Charlie slams the clipboard down on the seat.

segments.content: You think this is a joke? This is
funny? Jesus Christ! You know how
lucky you are you could get in here?
Thirty years old and all the crap
you pulled and you never got caught?
(angry)
That wasn't luck, old man. That was
skill. I was good at it.
Oh, yeah, it takes a lot of skill to
fence bulldozers. That's goddamn
genius time.
About as much skill as it takes to
sit in a truck and get fat eating
donuts.
Oh, so that's all I've been doing,
huh? Just wasting my life away.
I didn't say that.
Yeah, building a home, raising a
family -- that's just stupid.
I didn't say that!
You know what, Tom? I really don't
give a shit what you said.
Tom doesn't reply. Charlie puts the truck in gear; starts
off. Tom looks at Charlie, shakes his head -- what was that
about?

heading.subject: PEN ON PAPER
heading.raw_text: INT. ROADSIDE BAR - DUSK ECU PEN ON PAPER

segments.content: Writing letters in a crossword puzzle. Holding the pen is...

Late 50s, with a creased face and piercing eyes. He's sitting 

               at the bar, drinking coffee. Rain sheets down outside. The 

               BARTENDER watches TV, sound off. Next to Jim at the bar are...

Ray, 40s, has lank hair, rheumy eyes and a glass of Irish 

               whisky in front of him. Kenny, 20s, long hair, has the energy 

               of a puppy -- unfortunately he has about as much smarts as a 

               puppy. Mr. Mehlor. 40s, looks like -- and was -- a high school 

               teacher.

Sound off, a MAN is crying about what he has lost in the 

               flood.
"Thus saith the Lord; Behold, waters
shall rise up out of the north and
be an overflowing flood and all the
inhabitants of the land shall howl."
Ray takes a drink. Kenny leans over to Ray, sotto.

dialogue.text: Ray takes a drink. Kenny leans over to Ray, sotto.

segments.content: You're gonna be able to buy a helluva
lot of bibles, huh, Ray? Me? First
thing I'm gonna do is get my brother
a lawyer. Best that money can buy.
A thought comes to Jim -- an answer to a clue in the crossword --
and he starts filling in words as Ray and Kenny talk.
What's he facing?
Thirty in.
He cap a cop or something...?
Security guard. "In the commission..."
All he's got is a piece of shit P.D.
Now I'm gonna be able to afford him
a good lawyer -- a guy with a haircut.
Jim leans over to Kenny.
'Scuse me a second. Take a look at
thirty-one across.
Jim slides the newspaper in front of Kenny.
Shit, Jim. I don't do crossword
puzzles.
I'll take a look, Jim.
Kenny can read.
(to Kenny)
Just look at it. You know when you
write down a word and suddenly it
looks all wrong? Maybe it's right,
but it doesn't look right?
Jim points at the newspaper.
Kenny shrugs and looks down at the newspaper.

dialogue.text: Kenny shrugs and looks down at the newspaper.

segments.content: (mumbles as he reads)

His eyes go wide. ECU CROSSWORD PUZZLE In an uncompleted part of the puzzle, Jim has written a message in the boxes. It reads: MENTION MONEY AND I'LL KILL YOU. JIM AND KENNY Kenny looks up at Jim. Jim glances over at the bartender then back at Kenny. Understand?

dialogue.text: His eyes go wide. ECU CROSSWORD PUZZLE In an uncompleted part of the puzzle, Jim has written a message in the boxes. It reads: MENTION MONEY AND I'LL KILL YOU. JIM AND KENNY Kenny looks up at Jim. Jim glances over at the bartender then back at Kenny. Understand?

segments.content: Did I get it right?
INT. ARMORED TRUCK - DUSK Charlie and Tom continue to drive in silence. They both sneak looks at each other. Their eyes meet for a second, then they look away. A moment's pause then...

character.name: Yeah, Jim. You got it right.

dialogue.text: INT. ARMORED TRUCK - DUSK Charlie and Tom continue to drive in silence. They both sneak looks at each other. Their eyes meet for a second, then they look away. A moment's pause then...

segments.content: Jerk.
A hint of a smile on both of them. Tom reaches for Charlie.

dialogue.text: A hint of a smile on both of them. Tom reaches for Charlie.

segments.content: Charlie goes red in the face, pushes Tom away.

character.name: Give us a kiss. Come on.

dialogue.text: Charlie goes red in the face, pushes Tom away.

segments.content: Get out of here.
(laughs, beat)
You really are a cranky old fart,
you know that?
I'm sorry.
What was that about? I mean, I'm
just sitting here and all of a sudden
you go postal on me.
I don't know, I... It's just this
weather. I... I want to get back.
You know, I really do appreciate
what you've done for me. This is a
good job.
No, it's not. It stinks. It's putting
your life on the line for someone
else's money.

heading.raw_text: EXT. ROAD OUT OF TOWN - DUSK

segments.content:
Looking away from town, the HIGH SCHOOL is on the left. On 

               the right is the CEMETERY. Farther on, on the left, is a CAR 

               AND BOAT DEALERSHIP. The road is covered in water.

Goes by the entrance to the high school, water shooting up 

               from the wheels, pushing out in a wide wake.
Tom glances ahead and sees that the road is covered in water.
THEIR POV Stretching out ahead of them are reflector bars on the telephone poles, a few feet above the rippling surface of the floodwater.

dialogue.text: THEIR POV Stretching out ahead of them are reflector bars on the telephone poles, a few feet above the rippling surface of the floodwater.

segments.content: It's there.
(beat)
Somewhere. I hope.
(beat)
Look, Tom, I don't care what it is
you end up doing.
Oh, God, here we go again.
Tom sees something ahead. He doesn't understand at first. HIS POV The reflector bar on the pole two poles ahead is lower than the others. No reflector bars for a hundred yards, then they resume.

character.name: This is the last time, I swear.

dialogue.text: Tom sees something ahead. He doesn't understand at first. HIS POV The reflector bar on the pole two poles ahead is lower than the others. No reflector bars for a hundred yards, then they resume.

segments.content: (looks at Tom)
I just think, whatever it is you do,
it's time you did some heavy lifting.
Tom figures out what's going on with the reflector bars.
Stop!
No, you gotta hear this. You're better
than --
OUTSIDE THE TRUCK The water rises fast up the grille as the truck angles down. INSIDE THE TRUCK

character.name: Stop the truck! We're going down!

dialogue.text: OUTSIDE THE TRUCK The water rises fast up the grille as the truck angles down. INSIDE THE TRUCK

segments.content: Charlie stands on the brakes. THEIR POV A wave of water rushes forward from the truck, then comes back and washes over the hood, splashing up on the windshield.

dialogue.text: Charlie stands on the brakes. THEIR POV A wave of water rushes forward from the truck, then comes back and washes over the hood, splashing up on the windshield.

segments.content: Charlie throws the truck into reverse but gives it too much power. They hear the rear wheels spinning underwater. Charlie eases off, the tires start to catch, they start moving backwards. Charlie and Tom exchange a quick look of relief... and then the engine dies. Charlie tries to restart it, but there's nothing. OUTSIDE THE TRUCK It's stopped on a downgrade -- it's a dip in the road. The water is up to the top of the front tires: up to the hubcaps on the rear wheels. The headlights are underwater, spots of yellow glowing. They've stopped next to a lighted sign. CLOSE ON SIGN

Charlie eases off, the tires start to catch, they start moving backwards. Charlie and Tom exchange a quick look of relief... and then the engine dies. Charlie tries to restart it, but there's nothing. OUTSIDE THE TRUCK It's stopped on a downgrade -- it's a dip in the road. The water is up to the top of the front tires: up to the hubcaps on the rear wheels. The headlights are underwater, spots of yellow glowing. They've stopped next to a lighted sign. CLOSE ON SIGN

heading.time_of_day: HOME OF THE 1987 STATE CHAMPION WARRIORS.
heading.raw_text: HOME OF THE 1987 STATE CHAMPION WARRIORS.

segments.content: Goddammit!
It's a little dip in the road or
something. You can see the reflectors
come up the other side.
(curses to himself)
I knew this would happen.
(grabs radio mike)
I'll see if there's anyone coming.
Tom opens the door. Charlie adjusts the radio frequency selection button; clicks on.

character.name: Maybe we can get pulled out.

dialogue.text: Tom opens the door. Charlie adjusts the radio frequency selection button; clicks on.

segments.content: Dispatch, this is 31. 31 calling
dispatch.
(over radio)
31, this is dispatch.
(into radio)
Dispatch, we're stuck outside of
Huntingburg. Truck's dead.
Where are you?
We're on 231, headed for the
Interstate. Right by a sign saying
"Welcome to Huntingburg."
Tom climbs out and up on top of the truck.

Tom stands on top of the truck. In one direction, nothing 

               but blackness. The other way he can see the lights of the 

               town. But there are no cars coming.

Charlie looks over as Tom appears, upside-down, in the 

               doorway.
The town's been evacuated. We won't
get any help from there.
Dispatch can't get anyone out.
They are aware we're carrying a
shitload of money...?
They called the National Guard.
They're gonna be here in about ninety
minutes.
Ninety minutes? Jesus.
(nods; into radio)
Dispatch, we're gonna need help a
little sooner than --
There's a sudden sparking sound and the radio cuts out and
interior lights and the headlights go out.

INT. HOUSE - DUSK POV THROUGH WINDOW Looking out as the Sheriff's car rolls past on the water- covered street. A HAND lets go of a curtain and it swings across the window. EXT. STREET - DUSK IN THE SHERIFF'S CAR The Sheriff motions Wayne to stop the car, then he grabs the radio mike and clicks it on as a megaphone.

dialogue.text: INT. HOUSE - DUSK POV THROUGH WINDOW Looking out as the Sheriff's car rolls past on the water- covered street. A HAND lets go of a curtain and it swings across the window. EXT. STREET - DUSK IN THE SHERIFF'S CAR The Sheriff motions Wayne to stop the car, then he grabs the radio mike and clicks it on as a megaphone.

segments.content: (into mike)
No one comes out of the house.

character.name: Henry, I saw you. Come on out.

dialogue.text: No one comes out of the house.

segments.content: Henry, I'm not leaving until you
come out.
A few moments pass and then...
Late 70s, step out onto their porch.
Jesus H. Christ, Henry, I told you
to stay away from the damn window.
Gets out of the car.
What are you still doing here?
We're just --
We're setting traps.
That's illegal, Doreen.
You gonna arrest us, Sheriff? Hell,
are you even sheriff anymore, Sheriff?
Didn't you lose an election? I sure
as hell know I didn't vote for you,
and neither did Henry.
Doreen...
You don't need to set traps.
That's what they said in '73. When
we got back, anything the bastards
didn't steal they broke, just for
the hell of it.
That's not happening this time.
Damn right it's not.
You can't stay, you know that.
We're going to my sister's.
Good.

The Sheriff wants to say something more, but he's not about to argue with Doreen. He just nods and gets back into the car. IN THE CAR The Sheriff climbs back in. He and Wayne watch Henry and Doreen go back into the house, Doreen still nagging at Henry.

character.name: Soon as we finish setting the traps.

dialogue.text: The Sheriff wants to say something more, but he's not about to argue with Doreen. He just nods and gets back into the car. IN THE CAR The Sheriff climbs back in. He and Wayne watch Henry and Doreen go back into the house, Doreen still nagging at Henry.

segments.content: God'll understand if you have to
drown her in the basement, Henry.
The Sheriff sighs, nods to Wayne. Wayne puts the car in gear.
The water is creeping up the sloping hood of the truck.
We gotta get out of here.
What about the money?
The money's safe; we're not. Water
rose about a foot in the last twenty
minutes. The National Guard isn't
going to be here for another hour.

Tom shrugs -- Charlie's right. They're about to get out when light washes up on them. They look out to see... THE HEADLIGHTS OF A GMC SUBURBAN Approaching on the other side of the dip, a quarter-mile away. CHARLIE AND TOM Look at each other then get out of the truck. THE SUBURBAN Stops on the far side of the dip -- a hundred yards away. The headlights shine across the water. Doors open and MEN get out. TOM AND CHARLIE Come around the front of the truck. They can't see through the glare of the Suburban's bright headlights.

dialogue.text: Tom shrugs -- Charlie's right. They're about to get out when light washes up on them. They look out to see... THE HEADLIGHTS OF A GMC SUBURBAN Approaching on the other side of the dip, a quarter-mile away. CHARLIE AND TOM Look at each other then get out of the truck. THE SUBURBAN Stops on the far side of the dip -- a hundred yards away. The headlights shine across the water. Doors open and MEN get out. TOM AND CHARLIE Come around the front of the truck. They can't see through the glare of the Suburban's bright headlights.

segments.content: Hello!
You okay? You stuck?
Yes!
We'll see if we can get you out!
Charlie looks at Tom, relieved.

dialogue.text: Charlie looks at Tom, relieved.

segments.content: THE SUBURBAN Headlights go on high beam. CHARLIE AND TOM Squint, blinded by the high beams.

dialogue.text: THE SUBURBAN Headlights go on high beam. CHARLIE AND TOM Squint, blinded by the high beams.

segments.content: Why'd they do that?
Probably so they can see better.
Charlie looks at him -- what does he mean? Tom puts his hand on his pistol. IN THE WATER Assembled by the Suburban are... JIM AND HIS MEN All holding guns. He speaks to them quietly.

character.name: Or so we can't see at all.

dialogue.text: Charlie looks at him -- what does he mean? Tom puts his hand on his pistol. IN THE WATER Assembled by the Suburban are... JIM AND HIS MEN All holding guns. He speaks to them quietly.

segments.content: This is my retirement fund, boys,
and if any one of you screws up, I
swear to God I'll kill you. Let's
go.
They start wading down into the dip in the road. Kenny carries
a rifle.
Tom squints through the bright light.
Company dispatch and the National
Guard are the only ones who know
we're here.
Anyone with a scanner from Radio
Shack could've intercepted your call,
Charlie.
(realizes)
Jesus.
(to Jim and men)
Could you turn down your lights?!
We're bringing a rope!
Turn down your lights!

Tom starts to pull his gun. KENNY is fired up on adrenalin. He has his rifle up and is aiming it. HIS POV Tom with his hand on his pistol, starting to pull it out. TOM AND CHARLIE Charlie sees Tom going for his gun. He moves close to Tom, half in front of him, putting his hand on Tom's.

dialogue.text: Tom starts to pull his gun. KENNY is fired up on adrenalin. He has his rifle up and is aiming it. HIS POV Tom with his hand on his pistol, starting to pull it out. TOM AND CHARLIE Charlie sees Tom going for his gun. He moves close to Tom, half in front of him, putting his hand on Tom's.

segments.content: KENNY Stiffens. KENNY'S FINGER Squeezes the trigger of his rifle. TOM Jumps at the sound of the rifle crack. CHARLIE Is knocked back. TOM Yanks out his gun and starts shooting back. JIM AND HIS MEN Duck down in the water. TOM Shooting blindly, looks over and sees... CHARLIE A horrible look on his face, blood coming out of his neck. He sinks into the water. KENNY Shoots off another few quick rounds. TOM Drops into the water, bullets plugging in around him. Just his hand and pistol are visible, shooting blindly back toward Jim and his men. THE SUBURBAN Is hit by Tom's fire. TOM Runs out of bullets. A beat later we see Charlie start moving through the water -- Tom is pulling him.

dialogue.text: KENNY Stiffens. KENNY'S FINGER Squeezes the trigger of his rifle. TOM Jumps at the sound of the rifle crack. CHARLIE Is knocked back. TOM Yanks out his gun and starts shooting back. JIM AND HIS MEN Duck down in the water. TOM Shooting blindly, looks over and sees... CHARLIE A horrible look on his face, blood coming out of his neck. He sinks into the water. KENNY Shoots off another few quick rounds. TOM Drops into the water, bullets plugging in around him. Just his hand and pistol are visible, shooting blindly back toward Jim and his men. THE SUBURBAN Is hit by Tom's fire. TOM Runs out of bullets. A beat later we see Charlie start moving through the water -- Tom is pulling him.

segments.content: Doesn't hear Jim and keeps firing.
Aims his pistol at Kenny's head.
Kenny stops. BEHIND THE ARMORED TRUCK Tom comes up in the water behind the truck, gasping, holding Charlie. Tom rests his gun on the truck bumper.

dialogue.text: Kenny stops. BEHIND THE ARMORED TRUCK Tom comes up in the water behind the truck, gasping, holding Charlie. Tom rests his gun on the truck bumper.

segments.content: Charlie's gone. JIM AND HIS MEN Jim glares at Kenny, his eyes on fire.

dialogue.text: Charlie's gone. JIM AND HIS MEN Jim glares at Kenny, his eyes on fire.

segments.content: He was going for his gun!
He wasn't gonna shoot, Kenny.
Goddamnit!
(shakes head, calls
to Tom)
We just want the money! Get away and
we won't have to kill you!
Shuts his eyes, thinking, scared.
Tom opens his eyes. He looks down at... CHARLIE Floating in the water. TOM What the hell is he going to do? JIM AND HIS MEN Jim's men look at him. Jim motions them to wait some more.

dialogue.text: Tom opens his eyes. He looks down at... CHARLIE Floating in the water. TOM What the hell is he going to do? JIM AND HIS MEN Jim's men look at him. Jim motions them to wait some more.

segments.content: You got thirty seconds to get the
hell away!
Jim and the others wait, but there's no answer from Tom.

Still no response from Tom. THEIR POV All they can see is the front of the truck, in the light of the "Welcome" sign. They can't see the back. JIM AND HIS MEN Jim nods to his men. They head for the truck, down into the deeper water at the bottom of the dip in the road. All have guns up and ready. Jim sends Mr. Mehlor and Ray out to circle around. They all move quietly. The only sound is the rain. JIM Gets to the truck and moves along its side, Kenny right behind him. Jim gets to the back of the truck, nods for Kenny to cover him, then steps out behind the truck, gun up. JIM'S POV Tom is gone. CHARLIE Is floating in the water, eyes of glass. KENNY, MR. MEHLOR AND RAY Step into the circle of light thrown by the "Welcome" sign.

segments.content: (eyes Charlie)
Ah, Jesus.
(to Kenny)
Your dad'd be real proud of you,
Kenny.
He was going for his gun!
Mr. Mehlor, I believe we're gonna
need your science project.
Mr. Mehlor nods and digs into his pack. Ray looks down at
Charlie in the water.
"I shall bring floodwaters upon the
earth to destroy all that lives under
the heavens and every creature that
has the breath of life in it shall
perish." Genesis 6:17.
Ray laughs.

character.name: Were you a preacher or something?

dialogue.text: Ray laughs.

segments.content: Ray did five years in the hole at
Joliet. The only thing you get to
read in the hole is the Bible.
(to Ray)
You got religion?
Mr. Mehlor laughs as he pulls something out of his pack. It's... SMALL EXPLOSIVE DEVICE A half-stick of dynamite with a timer, mounted on a magnet.

dialogue.text: Mr. Mehlor laughs as he pulls something out of his pack. It's... SMALL EXPLOSIVE DEVICE A half-stick of dynamite with a timer, mounted on a magnet.

segments.content: When you hit the switch you've got
thirty seconds.
You teach your students how to make
things like that?
Mr. Mehlor puts the device on the back door.
You been to a high school recently,
Ray? My students taught me how to
make things like that. Ready?

Something's wrong. Jim touches the handle on the door. It moves. Uh-oh. He raises his pistol, grabs the door handle and pulls. The door swings open. We don't need to see what he sees -- we can tell from the expression on his face. EXT. ON THE ROAD Tom is running hard through the knee-deep water, pulling a string of canvas money bags buckled together. The truck and "Welcome" sign are two hundred yards behind him. Tom hears an angry yell. EXT. BY THE ARMORED TRUCK Kenny is the one yelling.

segments.content: They quiet. The patter of the rain is too loud -- they can't hear anything. Jim scans the horizon, but sees nothing.

dialogue.text: They quiet. The patter of the rain is too loud -- they can't hear anything. Jim scans the horizon, but sees nothing.

segments.content: Now why'd he have to go and do a
thing like that?
To stay alive.
(off their looks)
He thinks we'll kill him -- unless
he knows where the money is and we
don't.
There is another possibility.
(off their looks)
He's thinking of keeping it for
himself.
There's always that. Either way, we
got ourselves a sharp one.
Jim is looking at something in the distance.

dialogue.text: Jim is looking at something in the distance.

segments.content: Pretty soon the water'll be too deep
for him to run. But for us it'll be
just deep enough.
(unclear)

INT. CAR AND BOAT DEALERSHIP - SHOWROOM A glass window is smashed and water floods into the boat showroom. Jim and his men stride in. Kenny ogles a particularly nice cruiser. Jim stops at a smallish ski-boat.

segments.content: Here we go.
(re: cruiser)
What about this monster?
(re: ski-boat)
This is all we need.
Shit, Jim, we're stealing. Can't we
take anything we want?
The water isn't very deep yet. We
need something with a low draft. Mr.
Mr. Mehlor heads off. KENNY Sees something else he likes. We don't see what it is.

dialogue.text: Mr. Mehlor heads off. KENNY Sees something else he likes. We don't see what it is.

segments.content: EXT. CEMETERY The name WILLIAM PORTMAN is chiseled into a crypt. Tom appears from underwater, gasping for breath. He gets to his feet and trudges off through the water. EXT. ROAD OUTSIDE CEMETERY Tom comes out through the gates of the cemetery, splashing through the knee-deep water. He's running when he hears, from behind him, boat engines firing up. He turns to see... LIGHTS Racing toward him over the water, a hundred and fifty yards back. TOM Sprints off. THE SKI-BOAT Jim is steering the ski-boat. Mr. Mellor hunkers down beside him. We PULL BACK to see... TWO JET-SKIS Flanking the ski-boat, piloted by Kenny and Ray. ON THE ROAD Tom is running as fast as he can. He looks back, sees the ski-boat and jet-skis closing. They'll get him before he gets to town. He suddenly veers off the road toward... THE HIGH SCHOOL The sign out front reads: GO WARRIORS! EXT. HIGH SCHOOL Tom runs around the side of the high school. JIM AND HIS MEN Ride up on the ski-boat and jet-skis and round the corner. THEIR POV No sign of Tom.

segments.content: The engines are shut down. They all drift. Jim shines a flashlight over onto... WINDOWS There's a hole in a window large enough to climb through. INT. HIGH SCHOOL - CLASSROOM Tom wades through the classroom, pushing floating desks aside. Flashlight beams stab into the room. Tom hurries to the hall. EXT. HIGH SCHOOL Jim turns to his men.

segments.content: Let's get him out. But for Godsake,
whatever you do...
(with a hard look at
Kenny)
...don't kill him. Not until we find
out where he hid that money.

Tom makes his way past banks of lockers, trying to get as 

               far as he can from the probing flashlight beams.
Kenny drifts up to the front doors. He pulls on them. Locked.

MR. MEHLOR Reaches into his pack. INT. SCHOOL HALLWAY Tom tries lockers, looking for a place to hide. EXT. FRONT DOORS Kenny rides his jet-ski fast away from the front doors and the doors explode. INT. SCHOOL FRONT LOBBY Tom ducks down as... A FIREBALL Shoots over him. KENNY AND RAY Ride the jet-skis into the flooded school. UNDERWATER Tom is swimming as hard as he can, out of breath. KENNY AND RAY Ray goes off down a hall while Kenny idles in the lobby. TOM Surfaces, gasping. KENNY Hears the gasp, turns, grinning.

KENNY Guns it, racing forward down the hall toward Tom.

character.name: Enemy sub off the port bow!

RAY Is on his tail. TOM Makes his choice and guns the jet-ski straight at Kenny.

segments.content: (laughing)
Nice driving, buttwipe!
I'm glad you're enjoying this, Kenny,
but if he's dead, how do we find the
money?
Kenny reacts -- oh, right.

We see what Jim sees. ECU THROTTLE OF JET-SKI Tom used his tie to wrap the throttle open. HUNDRED YARDS AWAY Tom is hiding in the branches of a floating tree, watching the distant lights of Jim and his men. The current carries Tom away. WITH JIM AND HIS MEN Jim scans the horizon; sees nothing.

segments.content: Ray, I'm in need of a little
inspiration.
"With a raging flood he makes an end
of those who oppose him, and pursues
his enemies into darkness." From one
of the more obscure --
Sorry to interrupt Bible study and
all, but has no one but me noticed
how completely screwed we are? We
should be back in the motel room,
counting out the money. Instead --
Jim lashes out with a fist, hard and fast, hitting Kenny in
the chest, knocking him out of the ski-boat, into the water.
Kenny comes up in the thigh-deep water, sputtering.
No one likes this particular turn of
events, Kenny, but we have a choice --
we can can either deal with it or we
can walk away. There's a lot of money
out there, so I choose to deal with
it. If you want to go, that's fine --
start swimming. You want to stay,
that's fine, too -- just stop your
damn whining.
Jim pushes the throttle forward and the ski-boat takes off,
leaving Ray on the jet-ski, with Kenny in the water.
What the hell's his problem? All the
money in the world ain't worth a
goddamn nickel if you get caught.
It's not like there won't be other
jobs.
You may have more of these in you,

Ray pulls Kenny up onto the jet-ski and takes off after Jim. EXT. BACK OF CHURCH - SANDBAG WALL The water level is creeping up a five-foot-high wall of sandbags. REVERSE ANGLE Looking out over the top of the sandbag wall. A tree floats by on the water. HANDS Suddenly appear on the top of the wall and... TOM Pulls himself into view. He climbs over the wall, exhausted. BEHIND THE SANDBAG WALL Gasoline-powered pumps are sucking up any rainwater. The sandbags have kept the floodwater at bay. TOM He hurries up the back steps and goes into the church. INT. CHURCH - BACK ROOM Tom walks through a small room lined with closed cupboards. He goes through a door. INT. CHURCH - MAIN HALL Tom comes out into the altar. He looks around, impressed. It's a beautiful church. Scaffolding goes up one wall -- the church is being restored. Tom is startled by a sound from above. He grabs a heavy silver candlestick as a weapon and looks up to see... BIRDS Fluttering up in the rafters. TOM Takes a breath. Just as he relaxes, he hears a whooshing sound from behind him and turns to see... A LARGE CRUCIFIX Being swung at his head. Thunk and... THE SCREEN GOES BLACK FADE IN: INT. SHERIFF'S STATION Tom slowly regains consciousness, blinking his eyes. He hears...

segments.content: But the Sheriff isn't asking Tom, he's asking... KAREN 30, pretty, even in head-to-toe rain gear.

dialogue.text: But the Sheriff isn't asking Tom, he's asking... KAREN 30, pretty, even in head-to-toe rain gear.

segments.content: I was setting up pumps.
I sure as hell don't get what you
see in that church.
I wouldn't expect you to, Wayne.
What's that supposed to mean?
Karen, did you think the order was
for everyone but you to evacuate?
I was gonna go as soon as I filled
the pumps, but the next thing I know,
I've got a looter on my hands. Now,
maybe I'm crazy, but I was expecting
a little gratitude?
I think it's great what you did.
That's it, Phil. That'll finally get
you into her pants.
Shut up.
What if he'd had a gun, Karen? A lot
of these looters carry guns.
TOM Sits up on a cot, behind bars in the holding cell, woozy. INT. HIGH SCHOOL Jim and his men are searching the school for the money.

dialogue.text: TOM Sits up on a cot, behind bars in the holding cell, woozy. INT. HIGH SCHOOL Jim and his men are searching the school for the money.

segments.content: Jim, it could be anywhere. It might
not even be in the school.

EXT. MAIN STREET The rain sheets down hard. A lightning flash reveals... THE STATUE The water is up to the horse's knees. The lightning passes and a second later thunder rolls. INT. SHERIFF'S STATION The Sheriff, Phil, Wayne and Karen stand outside the cell. Tom is inside, on the cot. He touches the cut on his forehead.

dialogue.text: EXT. MAIN STREET The rain sheets down hard. A lightning flash reveals... THE STATUE The water is up to the horse's knees. The lightning passes and a second later thunder rolls. INT. SHERIFF'S STATION The Sheriff, Phil, Wayne and Karen stand outside the cell. Tom is inside, on the cot. He touches the cut on his forehead.

segments.content: What were you doing at the church?
I told you -- he was looting it.
I just said I'm not a looter!
(to Karen)
You're the one who nailed me?
(Karen nods)
You got a better arm than my ex-wife.
What the hell did you hit me with --
a statue? I saw a flash of some guy
coming at me.
(mumbles, embarrassed)
It was a crucifix.
(to others)
It was the only thing there!
Oh, great. Now I'm gonna have people
coming from around the world to see
the face of Jesus on my forehead.
Look, son, what were you doing in
the church?
Looking for a place to hide out.
From who -- Swamp Thing?
That stops the room.

character.name: The bastards who killed my partner.

dialogue.text: That stops the room.

segments.content: We were driving an armored truck.
The truck got stuck out past the
high school. They must've picked up
our call to dispatch, 'cause they
knew where we were. Charlie and I
were just standing there and all
hell broke loose.
How much money did you have?
They all exchange a look -- that's a lot of money.

dialogue.text: They all exchange a look -- that's a lot of money.

segments.content: The bank was afraid of looters. They
had us cleaning out their branches
up and down the river.
They stole three million dollars?
They all look at the Sheriff. He looks at Tom.

dialogue.text: They all look at the Sheriff. He looks at Tom.

segments.content: You took the money, didn't you.
I hid it in the cemetery. Tied it to
a crypt for a guy named Portman.
What the hell'd you do that for?
I don't like to carry around that
much cash.
Jesus, Wayne, use your head. If he
hadn't hidden it, they woulda killed
him, too.
The Sheriff looks at Tom -- is that it? Tom nods.
You got any ID?
No, it was in my jacket and I --
The Sheriff thinks for a beat, then tosses some keys to Phil.

dialogue.text: The Sheriff thinks for a beat, then tosses some keys to Phil.

heading.subject: Get out two rifles and a shotgun.
heading.raw_text: Get out two rifles and a shotgun.

segments.content:
Phil nods and goes to it. The Sheriff opens a desk drawer, 

               pulls out an ankle holster.
You believe him?
Well, yes, Wayne, I do. And even if
I didn't, I'd say we sure as hell
had an obligation to check it out,
don't you think?
The Sheriff starts strapping on the ankle holster.
I'll go with you. I can show you
where --
No, I think you better stay put. But
that was --
Yeah, all we need is an armored car
guy helping us out.
The Sheriff thwacks Wayne in the ear.
Ow!
Wayne, what's the worst that's ever
happened to you? When old Mrs. Dugan
went after you with a knife? This
(dismisses Wayne; to
Tom)
Phil comes over with the guns.

dialogue.text: Phil comes over with the guns.

segments.content: (to Phil)
Wayne and I'll check out the cemetery.
You escort Slugger...
(nods at Karen)
...out of town. Get her to some high
ground, then come on back.
The Sheriff jams a small pistol into his ankle holster.
I have to fill the pumps --
(pulling her out)
The Sheriff straightens up, grabs a rifle from Phil and pulls Karen to the door. Wayne goes to Tom's cell door and pulls it shut with a click.

dialogue.text: The Sheriff straightens up, grabs a rifle from Phil and pulls Karen to the door. Wayne goes to Tom's cell door and pulls it shut with a click.

segments.content: Wayne...
The Sheriff rolls his eyes and gestures for Wayne to come along. He opens the door for Karen, Wayne and Phil to go through.

dialogue.text: The Sheriff rolls his eyes and gestures for Wayne to come along. He opens the door for Karen, Wayne and Phil to go through.

segments.content: Sheriff -- they killed my partner
without any warning.
And they're gonna regret that, I
guarantee you. They're gonna regret
coming anywhere near this town
tonight. And out he goes.

Water is halfway up the four-foot high wall of sandbags around 

               the station. There are three outboard motorboats moored to 

               the sandbags.
The Sheriff and Wayne climb toward their boats.

dialogue.text: The Sheriff and Wayne climb toward their boats.

segments.content: You can do it, Phil. The men of
Huntingburg are counting on you.

He feels something weird. He looks down. ON THE FLOOR Water is seeping in under the door.

segments.content: EXT. PARK AREA The Sheriff and Wayne are motoring in their boats, zooming through the trees, engine noise obliterating anything coming in over the radio. INT. DAM CONTROL OFFICE

segments.content: (on the radio)
EXT. MAIN STREET - MOVING BOAT Phil steers Karen's small boat down Main Street, past the statue. The water is up to the rider's stirrups.

dialogue.text: EXT. MAIN STREET - MOVING BOAT Phil steers Karen's small boat down Main Street, past the statue. The water is up to the rider's stirrups.

segments.content: (pleading)
Did you see the stained glass windows,
Phil? Did you see what a good job
they did? I can't let anything happen
to the church, not after all I've
put into it.
Karen, you know I'd do anything for
you, but the Sheriff told me to get
you out of town. I'm sorry. It's for
your own good.
Karen stands up.
What're you doing?
If you're not going to take me back
to the church, then I'll swim.
Karen moves to get out of the boat.
Phil lets go of the throttle and stands, moving toward Karen.

dialogue.text: Phil lets go of the throttle and stands, moving toward Karen.

segments.content: Karen suddenly turns on Phil and pushes him out of the boat.

dialogue.text: Karen suddenly turns on Phil and pushes him out of the boat.

segments.content: Karen guns the engine and shoots off down a side street. Phil stands in the waist-deep water and watches her go, flabbergasted. EXT. CHURCH Karen comes around a corner and drives her boat up to the church. The water is swirling quietly, still a good three feet below the top of the wall. EXT. ROAD OUT OF TOWN - WELCOME SIGN Close on the lighted "Welcome to Huntingburg" sign. There's a rushing sound and a two-foot-high wall of water hits the sign. The lights explode in geysers of sparks and the water rushes on. EXT. PARK AREA The Sheriff and Wayne are racing through a grove of half- submerged trees. There's a rushing sound above the sound of the engines. WHAM! and they're hit by the wall of water. Wayne falls out of his boat and is lost in the swirling water. EXT. ALLEYWAY Jim and his men are motoring down an alleyway when... THE WALL OF WATER Rushes down the alley. RAY The water hits him hard, knocking him off the jet-ski. He's swept away by the water. CLOSE ON A FENCE LACED WITH CONCERTINA WIRE The surge water shoots through it. And suddenly there's... RAY Slammed up against the fence, pinned to it, water rushing over and around and by him. He yells as the wire cuts into him. EXT. CHURCH Karen is pouring gasoline into the pumps. She hears the rushing and looks up as the surge hits. Water shoots over the top. INT. SHERIFF'S STATION Tom hears the sound and opens his eyes -- what the hell is that? EXT. SHERIFF'S STATION The wall of water slams in hard, cascading over the sandbag wall. INT. SHERIFF'S STATION TOM SITS UP, SWINGING HIS LEGS OVER THE SIDE OF THE COT. HE REACTS, LOOKS DOWN. HIS POV There's two feet of water in the station. EXT. SHERIFF'S STATION The building is like a rock in a stream, with the water rushing up high against one wall, roiling and swirling around the sides. INT. SHERIFF'S STATION Tom looks over, stunned, to see... THE DOOR As a fine stream spits in through the keyhole. THE WINDOWS Are heaving as the water rises up against them. TOM Gets to his feet, woozy and goes to get out of the cell. He remembers -- uh-oh: the cell door is locked. EXT. ALLEYWAY Jim pulls Ray, coughing, choking, bleeding, into the ski- boat. INT. SHERIFF'S STATION The water level inside is rising fast. It hits the wall sockets and there's a spit of sparks, then all the desk lamps go dark. Light still comes from overhead fluorescent panels. Tom sees... TWO KEYS ON A KEY RING Laying on the Sheriff's wooden desk. They're four feet away -- too far to reach. EXT. CHURCH Karen suddenly has a horrible thought and stops. She shakes it off -- doesn't want to think about it -- and mutters to herself.

character.name: This is my boat. You swim.

segments.content: EXT. MAIN STREET Phil is clinging to the statue as the water surges by below him. EXT. PARK AREA Wayne gets back into his boat. The Sheriff realizes something.

dialogue.text: EXT. MAIN STREET Phil is clinging to the statue as the water surges by below him. EXT. PARK AREA Wayne gets back into his boat. The Sheriff realizes something.

segments.content: INT. SHERIFF'S STATION Tom looks through the cell bars at wooden chairs bobbing in the water. The Sheriff's desk lifts up, starts floating. Tom gets an idea. He takes his belt off. EXT. NEAR SHERIFF'S STATION A telephone pole is half-submerged, being pulled along fast by the current. INT. SHERIFF'S STATION Tom holds one end of the belt and tosses the rest of it at... THE DESK Bobbing in the rising water. He misses the keys. TOM AND THE DESK Tom tries again. The belt lands on the desk top. Tom very gently starts pulling. Too hard; the belt starts slipping off the desk. He gets it just right and the desk starts moving toward Tom. He reaches out with his hand, stretching. HIS FINGERS Touch the top of the desk, start pulling it toward him, and he just gets a firm grip on the desk when... THE TELEPHONE POLE Smashes into a window, bending in the bars on the window, shattering the glass, letting a torrent of water into the room. THE DESK Is moved by the rush of water, but not before Tom grabs... THE KEYS And grips them tight. TOM Tries the keys in the lock. They don't fit. He looks at them. CU KEYS The tag is emblazoned with the Ford logo.

segments.content: Tom tosses the keys into the water and looks around at... THE WATER LEVEL Rising very fast. A foot in ten seconds. TOM Climbs up the cell bars, the water rising with him. He's running out of room between himself and the ceiling. Three feet. Two feet. He's being pushed up by the water toward... FLUORESCENT LIGHT FIXTURE On the ceiling, caged in a wire cover. TOM Is terrified, about to die. The water rises up past his face. TOM'S HANDS Pull his Maglite flashlight from his belt. He takes off the lens and the battery cap, then shakes the batteries out. TOM Sticks the flashlight tube up through the wire grate over the light fixture. He blows out the water -- like clearing a snorkel -- then breathes. Reprieve for a few moments and then... THE WATER Reaches the top of the flashlight tube and starts to trickle in when... THE FLUORESCENT LIGHT FIXTURE Goes dark. In the darkness, there's the sound of tubes breaking and metal being wrenched. TOM Looks up, astonished, to see... THE FLUORESCENT FIXTURE Being lifted up and away from above. Streetlight comes in, silhouetting... A FIGURE Standing on the roof. The figure leans down and starts tugging at the wire cage over the inside of the fixture. In the light, Tom sees that it's... KAREN And she's pulling as hard as she can, but the wire cage isn't budging. She pulls out a Swiss Army knife, unfolds a small knife and starts taking out the screws holding the cage in place. She gets two screws out. TOM Pulls on the cage and it swings down. He climbs up it. EXT. SHERIFF'S STATION ROOF Tom surfaces in a hole in the roof. There's a vent duct laying on the roof -- Karen must've kicked that over to get to the light fixture. Karen helps Tom up. She sits and he lays down on the roof, catching his breath.

character.name: Great! I can drive out of here!

segments.content: Thank you.
I owed you -- for hitting you and
all. But we're even now, okay?
Even.
(beat, looks around)
What happened?
They get up.

dialogue.text: They get up.

segments.content: Maybe another levee broke upriver.

Just then... A PROPANE TANK Explodes. The fireball rips across the dark sky, illuminating everything, showing... JIM AND HIS MEN Fifty feet away -- Jim, Mr. Mehlor and Ray in the ski-boat and Kenny on the jet-ski -- guns aimed at Tom and Karen.

dialogue.text: Just then... A PROPANE TANK Explodes. The fireball rips across the dark sky, illuminating everything, showing... JIM AND HIS MEN Fifty feet away -- Jim, Mr. Mehlor and Ray in the ski-boat and Kenny on the jet-ski -- guns aimed at Tom and Karen.

segments.content: DARKNESS As the lightning passes, and in the darkness, the thunder rolls. JIM AND HIS MEN Switch on their lights and move forward. They pass... CARS Floating down the street with other debris. The cars have been damaged by the flood -- one is missing a door. JIM AND HIS MEN When they get closer to the Sheriff's station, what they see -- or don't see -- makes them stop. THEIR POV Tom and Karen have disappeared. Karen's boat is still moored to the Sheriff's station roof, empty.

segments.content: They're in the water! Kenny, cut
your engine!
Kenny shuts off the engine of the one remaining jet-ski. Jim
shuts down the boat engine. They float in silence, scanning
the water with their flashlights. There's no sign of Tom and
Karen.

Tom motions Karen to follow him. She's freaked and hesitates. 

               Tom grabs her hand and pulls her.

The ski-boat and jet-ski are right above them, flashlights 

               playing over the water.
Reach the roof of the Sheriff's station. Jim looks around.
Kenny, go that way. We'll go down
here.

heading.subject: POV THROUGH CAR WINDSHIELD
heading.raw_text: LONG SHOT POV THROUGH CAR WINDSHIELD

segments.content: Of Kenny and Jim heading off in different directions.
Rise into view in a car. They gasp for air and keep low.
Tell them where the money is.
I can't.
She's about to call out. Tom grabs her hard.

dialogue.text: She's about to call out. Tom grabs her hard.

segments.content: If they know where the money is,
they will kill us.
Before Karen can say anything, a flashlight beam comes
swinging toward them and they have to duck underwater.

Watches as his flashlight beam washes over the car. Nothing 

               there. He guns his engine and heads off down the street.
Floats off around a corner.

Tom and Karen surface, catch their breath. Quiet for a few 

               moments as they both look around to see that Jim and his men 

               are gone.
So what do we do?
I guess just drive around until we
run out of gas.
(pissed)
Look, I've spent the last eight months
of my life restoring that church,
and I just left it to come save your
ass, so spare me, okay?
(beat)
When we get down here a little further
we'll find a place for you to hide.
(off her look)
I'm gonna get back to the truck and
wait for the National Guard.
(checks watch)
Karen nods. Tom looks at her. She's shivering.

character.name: They should be there pretty soon.

dialogue.text: Karen nods. Tom looks at her. She's shivering.

segments.content: Cold?
No, I'm fine. The heater just kicked
in.
Tom looks at her, gives a little grin. Their eyes meet for a
second, then they look away.

Phil climbs up onto the roof, exhausted. He sees the hole in 

               the roof and goes to look at it. As he's looking down...
Phil turns to see... THE SHERIFF AND WAYNE Coasting up in their boats.

dialogue.text: Phil turns to see... THE SHERIFF AND WAYNE Coasting up in their boats.

segments.content: No. Someone got him out.
Who?
(hesitates)
Maybe Karen.
Karen? How could she get him out?
You took her out of town.
I -- It --
Let's hear it, Phil.
EXT. ALLEYWAY Tom and Karen float down the alley in the car.

dialogue.text: EXT. ALLEYWAY Tom and Karen float down the alley in the car.

segments.content: You ever been robbed before?
No. The scariest thing that ever
happened before was Charlie running
out of donuts.
(off her look)
I've only been doing this for a couple
months.
(not what she wanted
to hear)
Silence for a few moments.

dialogue.text: Silence for a few moments.

segments.content: What'd you do before this?
I, uh... I sold construction
machinery.
(off her look)
I was making good money, it just...
I don't know. It just didn't seem
right for me anymore.
How'd you end up in this?
My uncle did me a favor; got me in.
Nice favor. How's he gonna feel after
tonight?
My uncle was Charlie -- my partner
in the truck.
Tom nods -- so is he. EXT. SHERIFF'S STATION Phil climbs into the Sheriff's boat.

dialogue.text: Tom nods -- so is he. EXT. SHERIFF'S STATION Phil climbs into the Sheriff's boat.

segments.content: She know karate or something, Phil?
Maybe kung fu? I mean, I can't see
how else she could overpower the
likes of you.
Shut up, Wayne.
Shut up, both of you. Let's go find

The Sheriff fires up his engine and heads off, Wayne following. EXT. ALLEYWAY Karen and Tom are still in the car. They freeze at the sound of engines in the distance. The sounds fade. Tom looks around.

character.name: Karen; see if she's got him.

dialogue.text: The Sheriff fires up his engine and heads off, Wayne following. EXT. ALLEYWAY Karen and Tom are still in the car. They freeze at the sound of engines in the distance. The sounds fade. Tom looks around.

segments.content: Karen plucks some cassette tapes out of the water.

character.name: God, I wonder whose car this is.

dialogue.text: Karen plucks some cassette tapes out of the water.

segments.content: Well, whoever it is, he listens to
Pat Benatar, Eddie Money and the
soundtrack to "Footloose."
Really?
(looks at tapes)
Hold on...
(looks around car)
...I think this is my car from high
school.
Karen laughs. Just then...
Gets caught on something and stops.
Looks like we get out here.
(Karen hesitates)
Come on -- I told your father I'd
have you home by ten.
Karen grins. Just then...
down the street explodes.
Hear a sparking sound and look over to see...

On a telephone/power pole close to them. Rain hits it, causing 

               the sparking sound. The floodwater is inching up the pole 

               toward it.

               The water will reach the transformer in a matter of seconds. 

               And while they're staring at that...
At the end of the street explodes as water hits it.
Look around -- what to do? Tom points.

They climb out of the car and start swimming toward a house. THE TRANSFORMER Water is three inches from the transformer; two inches... TOM AND KAREN Swimming as hard as they can. THE TRANSFORMER One inch from the water... TOM AND KAREN Reach the house. They pull themselves up onto a television antenna/ladder running up the side of the house. Karen's feet are still in the water.

segments.content: THE TRANSFORMER The water is about to touch. There's a sizzling sound. TOM AND KAREN They heave a huge sigh of relief -- but then Tom realizes...

dialogue.text: THE TRANSFORMER The water is about to touch. There's a sizzling sound. TOM AND KAREN They heave a huge sigh of relief -- but then Tom realizes...

segments.content: Oh, shit!
What?
(re: antenna/ladder)

Tom pushes Karen over onto a window ledge. Then, just as Tom's about to step over... KENNY Comes screaming in on the jet-ski. He dives off the jetski, gets a hold of Tom and pulls him under. KENNY AND TOM Surface. Kenny is stronger and he has Tom in a tight grip. One problem -- Kenny doesn't know the danger they're in.

segments.content: Kenny shoves Tom underwater.

dialogue.text: Kenny shoves Tom underwater.

segments.content: Tom comes up, looks over at...
The sizzling is getting louder.
Kenny dunks Tom again.

dialogue.text: Kenny dunks Tom again.

segments.content: Tom grabs Kenny's arms and pulls himself up fast.

Tom's head comes out of the water and slams into Kenny's 

               chin. Kenny is stunned. Tom gets free of his grasp.

Tom does the backstroke, pulling hard toward Karen. KENNY Still stunned, finally hears the sizzling and looks over at... THE TRANSFORMER The water touches the outer casing of the transformer. KENNY Starts swimming fast toward... TOM AND KAREN Karen grabs Tom's arm and Tom gets a hold of the windowsill and pulls himself up. KENNY Grabs onto... THE TV ANTENNA And starts pulling himself out of the water. THE TRANSFORMER Explodes. KENNY Feels pretty pleased with himself until... THE TV ANTENNA Starts dancing with electricity and... KENNY Is hit by the voltage and his teeth clamp shut and his body goes rigid and his clothes explode in flames. TOM AND KAREN Look away. THE WATER Dead fish start floating to the surface. KENNY Is fried, smoking. He falls off the TV antenna and hits the water with a loud and ugly hiss. He floats away, his body shaking spasmodically. TOM AND KAREN Tom hears an engine approaching. He looks around, then smashes the window with his elbow. INT. HOUSE The window glass tumbles in. Tom reaches in, undoes the latch and slides up the window. He climbs in, straddling the window sill. The camera moves down Tom's leg to show... A WOLF TRAP Laying on the floor, just below the window. TOM Is oblivious. He starts to put his foot down into the trap. Just then he knocks... A POTTED CACTUS Off the windowsill. It falls straight down into... THE WOLF TRAP Hitting the trigger. The jaws snap, obliterating the cactus.

segments.content: A SHOTGUN BARREL Snaps into view, pointing right at Tom's head.

dialogue.text: A SHOTGUN BARREL Snaps into view, pointing right at Tom's head.

segments.content: You so much as breathe funny and
your head is going back out that
window without you.

Jim drives the boat down the street. Mr. Mehlor is scanning 

               the water with a flashlight.

Jim looks over to see... THE JET-SKI Floating in the water. And not far from it is... KENNY Still twitching. OMITTED Sequence omitted from original script. INT. HOUSE - BEDROOM Doreen holds the shotgun on Tom and Karen as they move away from the window, hands raised.

dialogue.text: Jim looks over to see... THE JET-SKI Floating in the water. And not far from it is... KENNY Still twitching. OMITTED Sequence omitted from original script. INT. HOUSE - BEDROOM Doreen holds the shotgun on Tom and Karen as they move away from the window, hands raised.

segments.content: Real slow now. Like you were in a
big jar of molasses. That's it.
They hear footsteps coming down old wood stairs.
Doreen? You haven't killed anybody,
have you?
I've got everything under control,
Henry enters.

dialogue.text: Henry enters.

segments.content: Jesus, Doreen, you caught a whole
gang.

Jim and Mr. Mehlor pull Kenny into the ski-boat. Kenny is 

               shivering. Part of his hair has been burned away.
Jesus, God, it hurts!
You're gonna be okay, Ken. Mr. Mehlor
knows these things and he thinks
you're gonna be okay.
Mr. Mehlor looks at Jim. Mr. Mehlor knows these things and
he thinks Kenny is going to die.
It hurts!
Don't you, Mr. Mehlor? Don't you
think Kenny's gonna be okay?
Yeah, Kenny. You're gonna be fine.
Mr. Mehlor moves aside. Jim puts his arms around Kenny.

dialogue.text: Mr. Mehlor moves aside. Jim puts his arms around Kenny.

segments.content: I know you didn't want me to come.
You kidding? We couldn't've done
anything without you.
My dad'd sure be pissed off, huh?
Your dad'd just want you to lay still
while we got you some help.
Hey -- hey the pain's goin'.
(relief)
He looks up at Jim and grins.

dialogue.text: He looks up at Jim and grins.

segments.content: When you said I was gonna be okay, I
thought you were just shittin' me.

Kenny's shivering stops. It stops because he's dead. Jim slowly lets go. INT. HENRY AND DOREEN'S ATTIC Henry and Doreen have brought everything into their attic -- a TV, some silver and china, bowling trophies. A Coleman lantern lights the room.

dialogue.text: Kenny's shivering stops. It stops because he's dead. Jim slowly lets go. INT. HENRY AND DOREEN'S ATTIC Henry and Doreen have brought everything into their attic -- a TV, some silver and china, bowling trophies. A Coleman lantern lights the room.

segments.content: (sarcastic)
Well, isn't that just wonderful! Now
these bastards are gonna want to
kill us, too! Why the hell did you
have to come to this house?
We thought it was empty.
You know what? The house next door
is empty. So whaddya say we go back
downstairs and you two keep moving?
We are not going to send these people
out to the wolves.
Oh, we're not, are we? Then what's
your plan, General Schwartzkopf?
I -- I just don't think --
They look at him, surprised.

character.name: It's okay. I have to go anyway.

dialogue.text: They look at him, surprised.

segments.content: The National Guard'll be at the truck
in about fifteen minutes. I'm gonna
go wait for them.
You can't swim that far in fifteen
minutes.
He could take our boat.
Henry!
(to Tom)
I'll go get it ready for you.
Henry ignores Doreen. He pushes the attic stairs down, heads down them.

character.name: Henry, he is not taking our boat.

dialogue.text: Henry ignores Doreen. He pushes the attic stairs down, heads down them.

segments.content: (grabs TV; to Tom)
Here. You want a TV too? How about
some china? Maybe our silver?
(sets TV down)
Henry! Henry, you leave the boat
where it is!
Doreen heads off down the stairs. Tom starts down the stairs,
stops.
Karen?
(she looks at him)
They shake hands.

dialogue.text: They shake hands.

segments.content: Watch yourself, Tom. I really don't
wanna have to save your life again.
Tom nods and goes down the stairs.

Henry stands on the roof of the back porch, steadying a small 

               rowboat as Tom gets in. Doreen nags from the window.
You give away our only boat in the
middle of a flood. You are a genius,
Henry. A goddamn genius.
(whispers to Henry,
re: Doreen)
Henry looks at Tom, entertaining the notion...

dialogue.text: Henry looks at Tom, entertaining the notion...

segments.content: Jesus, Henry, what are you waiting
for -- a kiss goodbye? Get back in
here.
Henry sighs and lets go of the boat. Tom rows off.
We see him in silhouette, crossing the gap between two houses.
Are watching, from the shadows on the dark side of the street.

EXT. MAIN STREET Wayne and Hank are alongside the Sheriff, engines idling as they look at the church.

dialogue.text: EXT. MAIN STREET Wayne and Hank are alongside the Sheriff, engines idling as they look at the church.

segments.content: (nods, to Hank)
Hank nods, guns his engine.

dialogue.text: Hank nods, guns his engine.

segments.content: (to Hank)
Wait -- what about the dam?
It'll be fine.
You said if it goes it'll wipe out
the town.

Hank nods in agreement and takes off. INT. CHURCH Jim and Tom are by one of the stained glass windows, looking out through a pale-colored pane at the Sheriff and his men across the street. They watch Hank race off.

dialogue.text: Hank nods in agreement and takes off. INT. CHURCH Jim and Tom are by one of the stained glass windows, looking out through a pale-colored pane at the Sheriff and his men across the street. They watch Hank race off.

segments.content: Does he have the girl?
(shakes head)
Tom touches the wound on his head.

dialogue.text: Tom touches the wound on his head.

segments.content: Jesus, I'm gonna get hepatitis.
Hepatitis, hell. You probably already
got cholera.
Tom gives Jim a look then starts for the back of the church.
What're you doing?
There's a back room.
(touches wound)
Maybe they've got something I can
use on this.
You been in here before?
(bad memory)
Oh, yeah.
What happened?

EXT. DAM Water is starting to go over the top again. It pours down in sheets over the face of the dam. INT. CHURCH Jim is by the window, looking out at the Sheriff and Wayne across the street in the shadows. He turns as... TOM Enters from the back. He's got a bottle of rubbing alcohol and a towel. He splashes some of the alcohol on the towel, then touches it to his wound. It hurts like a sonofabitch. After a beat...

He splashes some of the alcohol on the towel, then touches it to his wound. It hurts like a sonofabitch. After a beat...

segments.content: So, has this all gone pretty much
how you thought it would?
Jim turns on Tom.
Everything would have gone fine if
you'd've just walked away from the
truck.
Oh, yeah? Well, everything would've
gone even better if you hadn't decided
to rob the damn truck in the first
place!
Jim looks away. After another silence...
Did Charlie have cancer or something?
You mean why was he doing this?
(thinks, shrugs)
No cancer.
(beat)
Didn't you ever think about taking
the money?
No.
Come now. A man who used to make his
living fencing hot jackhammers never
thought about what he'd do with three
million dollars?
Sorry to disappoint you.
(beat)
What are you gonna do with it?
Silence for a few moments, then...

dialogue.text: Silence for a few moments, then...

segments.content: Jim looks at him.

dialogue.text: Jim looks at him.

segments.content: It's this small country in Central
America, on the Atlantic side.
I know where Belize is. What about
it?
They speak English and the dollar
goes a long way. Beautiful beaches;
friendly people. And they've got
liberal banking laws. Very liberal.
No, you didn't think about taking
that money at all.
(busted)
You can't ride in the truck and not
think about it.
I'm sure. And I guess that's pretty
much how it started with Charlie.
Tom thinks, nods and presses the towel to his wound again.

Wayne is thinking about something. He makes a decision and 

               flicks on his engine.
What're you doing?
We got too many bodies with bullets
in 'em.
(nods at Karen)
I'm gonna put her in her house, make
it look like she fell down the stairs
and drowned.
Don't you touch her!
Saving her life... Hmm... You know,
that might have actually gotten you
laid.
Oh, for Christsakes, just dump her
here.
We got a few minutes before Hank
gets back.
Wayne ignores the Sheriff and motors off.

dialogue.text: Wayne ignores the Sheriff and motors off.

segments.content: Wayne! Goddamnit, we've gotta get
them outta there! Wayne!
But Wayne keeps going.
Tom watches Wayne drive off with Karen.
Tom grabs a rifle, frustrated and angry. EXT. MAIN STREET Hank motors up to the Sheriff and Phil.

dialogue.text: Tom grabs a rifle, frustrated and angry. EXT. MAIN STREET Hank motors up to the Sheriff and Phil.

segments.content: Where's Wayne going?
On a date. You all set?
Yeah, but --
Then let's go.
Aren't we gonna wait for Wayne?
We can get started without him, the
dumb shit. He won't be long. Besides,
we got Phil. Phil's gonna earn his
money on this, aren't you Phil?
Phil looks scared shitless.

Water continues to pour over the top. CLOSE ON CONCRETE

               Chunks of cement are starting to wash away.
Tom finishes reloading a gun.
Tom doesn't answer. He moves toward the front door. Jim cuts him off.

character.name: What -- you're gonna swim after her?

dialogue.text: Tom doesn't answer. He moves toward the front door. Jim cuts him off.

segments.content: You ain't gonna help her by getting

heading.subject: shot. He's gone and you don't know
heading.raw_text: shot. He's gone and you don't know

segments.content: where.
The Sheriff knows. I think maybe
I'll go ask him.
You'll be dead before you get over
the sandbags.
(beat)
Look, he'll be coming for us. You
can ask him then.
Jim sees something out the window.
What if he doesn't come?

Tom sees what Jim sees. THEIR POV The Sheriff, Phil and Hank are heading toward the church, flaming Molotov cocktails in their hands. EXT. SIDE OF CHURCH The Sheriff, Phil and Hank heave the flaming Molotov cocktails. THE ROOF The bottles hit, explode. Sheets of fire rain down the roof. ONE BOTTLE Smashes through a window. INT. CHURCH Tom and Jim duck down as... THE BOTTLE Flies across the inside of the church and smashes against a wall, sending sheets of fire down the wall. EXT. CHURCH The roof is on fire. EXT. KAREN'S HOUSE Modest, two-story, on a side street. The front door is open; the boat tied up outside. There's a light on in the front hall. INT. KAREN'S HOUSE Karen is unconscious. Wayne has her laying on the stairs leading up from the entry area to the second floor. There's three feet of water in the house. Karen's legs are in the water. Her hands are handcuffed to a railing attached to the wall, running up the stairs. Wayne stands over Karen, pats her face.

segments.content: Karen stirs, then starts slipping back into unconsciousness, so Wayne splashes her face with water. Karen comes to, sputtering. Her eyes focus. She looks up at Wayne. Wayne grins.

dialogue.text: Karen stirs, then starts slipping back into unconsciousness, so Wayne splashes her face with water. Karen comes to, sputtering. Her eyes focus. She looks up at Wayne. Wayne grins.

segments.content: Dear Penthouse: I always thought
your letters were fake, until the
wildest thing happened to me. I'm a
policeman in a small town. In the
middle of the big flood last year, I
was patrolling the streets in a boat,
feeling kind of sorry for myself --
'cause it was my birthday and all --
when I saw the front door to a house
was open. I pulled my gun -- afraid
it might be looters. Imagine my
surprise when, instead of a looter,
I find a young woman handcuffed to
the railing of her stairs. Her name
was Karen, and ever since she came
back from college she'd made it clear
she was too good for any of us local
folk. Now here she was, in handcuffs!
I said, "What the heck is going on
here, ma'am?" And she said...
Karen says nothing. Wayne leans in close.
And she said...
Sorry, Wayne, but I'm not playing a
part in your sick little play.
Wayne pulls his gun, puts it to Karen's head.
You're perfect for the role. I suggest
you reconsider.
Or what? You'll kill me? You're gonna
do that anyway.
I might get clumsy. It might take a
while.
I'm sure you can hurt me. But it's
all going to be the same when I'm
dead.
Wayne straightens up, looks at her, then launches back into
it.
And she said, "Happy Birthday, Wayne.
I've got something for you." Well,
I'm not stupid. I knew what she wanted
to give me and I knew she wanted to
give it bad, so I --
Sparks and goes out.
(looks up at light)
That won't do. Man's gotta see what
he's doing. 'Scuse me.
Wayne heads off for the kitchen. The second he's gone...

Raises her hips and digs a hand into her pocket and pulls 

               out her Swiss Army knife. She pries open the big blade. She 

               hears Wayne sloshing back toward her. She gets back into the 

               position Wayne left her in as...
Re-enters carrying two burning candles in candle-holders.
I got the candles. All's we need is
a cake.
He sets the candles down on a dry step above Karen's head.
He leans in close.
Mood lighting. You in the mood yet?
(no answer from Karen;
back into Penthouse
letter)
And then she said, "My present's
ready and waiting. All's you gotta
do is unwrap it."
Wayne reaches into the water, undoes Karen's rain pants,
yanks off her shoes, then pulls off her pants. He throws
them over the banister. Karen remains passive, blank. Wayne
takes off his holster; hangs it on the banister. Then he
pushes his pants down to his ankles. His shirttail is long
enough so that we don't have to see his wretched little
pecker. He climbs on top of Karen in the water, brings his
face close to hers.
It was cold and rainy that birthday
night, and all I wanted was to get
someplace warm and dry. As it turned
out, what I really wanted was
something warm and wet. Wayne grins
and closes for a kiss and...
Moves fast with the knife and...
Pop open wide.

His head jerks back. He tries to shout, but all that comes 

               out is an awful gurgle. He tries to push off Karen, but...
Wraps her legs around him, holds him close, pinning him.

Finally breaks free. He tries to stop the bleeding with a 

               hand, but the blood spurts through his fingers. He reaches 

               for his gun in his holster on the banister, but just as he 

               grabs it...

Lashes out of the water with her legs, kicking Wayne in the 

               groin, pushing him back.

Tries to get his balance, but his feet can't move -- his 

               pants are around his ankles. He falls back into the water, 

               firing his pistol.

Blow chunks out of the wall next to Karen, hit the ceiling 

               and...
Is floating on his back, trying to lift the pistol, but his

heading.subject: strength is fading fast. He gets off one last shot and...
heading.raw_text: strength is fading fast. He gets off one last shot and...

segments.content: Nearest Karen is blown to pieces.

heading.subject: The gun drops into the water. No more shots. No more life.
heading.raw_text: The gun drops into the water. No more shots. No more life.

segments.content: He floats, pants around his ankles, covered in blood, dead.

EXT. STREET AND CHURCH The church roof is on fire. THE SHERIFF, PHIL AND HANK Are across the street. INT. CHURCH Jim and Tom hear a creaking and look up. THE CEILING The fire has eaten holes in the roof. Embers come down. EXT. CHURCH AND STREET The Sheriff is getting very agitated.

segments.content: They're not coming out, Hank!
The fire's not catching. The rain's
too --
We have to get them! We have to kill
them! Do you understand? If they're
not dead, we got jack shit!

A small chunk of burning ceiling drops down. Jim and Tom 

               look up. Just then...
Floods into the church through...
Filling the church with a kaleidoscope of colors.
Look out the windows.

THE STAINED GLASS WINDOWS Remain beautiful for a few more seconds until they shatter and blow inwards as... THE SHERIFF'S BOAT AND HANK'S BOAT Come crashing through. THE BOATS Land, stop fast. The Sheriff's boat lands closer to the pulpit; Hank's boat closer to the balcony. THE SHERIFF, HANK AND PHIL Look around. It's quiet for a moment. There's no sign of Tom and Jim. INT. KAREN'S HOUSE Karen has her pants back on. She reaches out with one foot and hooks Wayne's holster off the banister. She flips it through the air and catches it with her hands. She opens little leather pockets -- mace, more bullets. No keys. Karen starts to panic.

segments.content: She sees... WAYNE Still floating on his back, still dead. She looks closer at... WAYNE'S PANTS Bunched around his ankles. And there, hanging from a belt- loop is a ring of keys. KAREN Reaches out with her foot for Wayne's pants. She can't reach. WAYNE Is slowly drifting out the open door. Beyond the door, in the light of the streetlamp, the water is riffling, moving, and Wayne is heading toward it. KAREN Slides down further on the stairs, into the water, then stops. CLOSE ON HANDCUFFS AND RAILING There are metal supports going from the railing to the wall, every three feet. Karen is prevented from going any further down the stairs by one of these supports. KAREN Reaches out with a foot, straining, stretching her body, almost dislocating her shoulder and... HER FOOT Just barely touches one of Wayne's feet, but then Wayne's foot slips away and... KAREN Can only watch as... WAYNE Drifts out the door and is pulled away by the current. EXT. RESERVOIR DAM Water is cascading over the top of the dam. Chunks of concrete are washing away. INT. CHURCH The Sheriff, Phil and Wayne scan the water, looking for movement.

segments.content: UNDERWATER POV Looking up through a tangle of floating pews at the wavering silhouettes of the boats and the men in them against the burning timbers above. TWO PISTOLS Come into view, pointed up through the water. ON THE WATER The Sheriff, Phil and Hank have let down their guard for a second when there's a series of dull, muted clacks from underwater as... BULLETS Come streaking out of the water, winging by them, plugging into the boats. UNDERWATER Jim fires the pistols, the bullets' bubble streaks knifing up through the water. THE SHERIFF, PHIL AND HANK hit the deck in their boats, returning fire over the gunwales. TOM Surfaces over by the stairs up to the balcony, gasping for air. He runs for the stairs. BLAZING TIMBERS Start to fall from the burning roof frame, hitting the water with loud sizzling hisses. THE SHERIFF, PHIL AND HANK Turn to shoot at tom through the dropping flaming debris. TOM Disappears up the stairs, the bullets just missing him. UNDERWATER Jim runs out of bullets. He's long since run out of air. He drops his guns and swims under the pews. HANK Looks up, realizing that Tom will be able to shoot down on him. He reverses his boat fast under the balcony as... TOM Shoots down from the balcony, blowing a chunk out of the prow of Hank's boat. INT. KAREN'S HOUSE The water is up to Karen's chin. Her hands are working frantically beneath the water. UNDERWATER She's using the tip of the knife blade to unscrew the screws holding the support to the railing. She's on the last one. The blade slips, misses, gets a quarter turn, another quarter turn... KAREN Spits out the water that spills into her mouth. UNDERWATER Another quarter-turn and the screw is loose enough to turn by hand. KAREN Holds her breath with the water touching her nose. She gets the screw loose, pulls up on the railing and pulls the handcuff through the gap between the support and the railing. INT. CHURCH The Sheriff turns to Phil and nods re: Jim.
